summary: Frankie critiques celebrities who claim to be vegan but consume animal products, revealing inconsistencies in their dietary choices and motivations.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man standing against a plain white background, wearing a black V-neck T-shirt and a necklace. He is seen making various hand gestures, including clasping his hands together, pointing with his index fingers, and spreading his arms wide. The man appears to be speaking or presenting something, as indicated by his expressive hand movements and facial expressions. The scene then transitions to a woman with long brown hair, wearing a black blazer and pearl earrings, standing against an orange background. She is shown in a close-up shot, with her face blurred. The video then shifts to another woman with long brown hair, wearing a white dress with thin straps, standing against a black background with the text "Kleenex" and "Disney" visible. The woman is also shown in a close-up shot, with her face blurred. The video concludes with a black screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker addressing the subject of celebrities and veganism. He speaks in a conversational tone, suggesting that some celebrities are being paid to be plant-based while others couldn't maintain the diet. He cites Angelina Jolie as an example, saying that she claimed the diet nearly ended her life because she wasn't getting enough nutrition.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of an article titled "Angelina Jolie Says Red Meat Is Her Beauty Secret," written by Amanda Radke and dated September 2, 2010. The article discusses Angelina Jolie's preference for red meat despite her vegan diet and her marriage to a strict vegetarian. The scene transitions to a man in a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. The video then shifts to a couple sitting on a couch, with the woman in an orange top and the man in a blue shirt, both smiling and looking towards the camera. The next scene shows the same couple at a red carpet event, with the man in a black suit and the woman in a strapless dress, posing for the camera. The video concludes with a return to the man in the black t-shirt, continuing his speech with expressive hand movements.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker stating that the beauty secret is "big, juicy steaks." He follows this up with how women would be choking down sticks of butter every single supermarket and how the media has women under the belief that eating meat is not conducive to beauty. He then mentions Dax Shepard and Kristen Bell deciding to go vegan in 2012 after watching Forks Over Knives, with both struggling with the switch and Kristen being a vegetarian who enjoys the occasional dairy product. The speech has an informative and somewhat sarcastic tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a vibrant orange background featuring a playful illustration of a man and a woman sitting on a stylized white and black arch, surrounded by whimsical elements like trees, clouds, and a skull. The text "Meet Mom & Dad" appears prominently, followed by a humorous tagline, "Yep, we started a parenting company! We're here for you (just don't ask us to change diapers)." A call-to-action button labeled "Start Bundling" is visible, inviting viewers to engage further. The scene transitions to a person wearing a black V-neck T-shirt, standing against a plain white background, gesturing expressively as if explaining or narrating something. The video then shifts to a close-up of a webpage article titled "Jared Leto Gets Back to His Many Faces," featuring a photograph of a man in a black suit with a red flower on his lapel. The article discusses Jared Leto's diverse roles and personal life, including his vegan diet and experiences with his mother. The video returns to the person in the black T-shirt, who continues to speak and gesture, maintaining a consistent and engaging presence against the simple white backdrop.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker, sounding judgmental, who mentions a couple that supports a plant-based lifestyle and launched a vegan baby line, “Hello Bello,” and questions if this makes them evil, implying they are “demons disguised as humans.” The speaker references Jared Leto, who credits his youth to sleep and a vegan diet, calling him a “cheating vegan,” and expresses his frustration with the glamorization of vegan diets. The clip ends abruptly with the last word.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, gesturing with his hands as if explaining something. The scene transitions to a formal event where a man in a blue suit and a woman in a sparkling dress are seated at a table, suggesting a celebratory or formal gathering. Following this, a woman in a pink strapless dress is seen walking outdoors, with a blurred background indicating movement. The narrative then shifts to a woman in a light blue top sitting indoors, with a bookshelf in the background, creating a calm and intimate atmosphere. The video concludes with a man in a dark suit and a woman in a beige coat standing together outdoors, surrounded by greenery, indicating a serene and possibly significant moment. Throughout the video, the focus is on the individuals' attire, gestures, and the settings that accompany them, providing a glimpse into various aspects of their lives.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker expressing skepticism about vegans, claiming they "continuously lie" about who is vegan. He cites examples like Channing Tatum, who only practiced veganism for a short time, and Meghan Markle, who ate vegan during the week. The speaker's tone is critical, bordering on mocking, as he questions the glamorization of a vegan diet. His delivery is consistent throughout the clip. There are no other sounds present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black t-shirt, standing against a plain white background, speaking and gesturing with his hands. He appears to be explaining or discussing a topic, as indicated by his expressive hand movements and facial expressions. The scene transitions to another man, also in a black t-shirt, standing in front of a colorful backdrop with the word "BOXING" visible, suggesting a sports-related context. The video then shifts to a webpage titled "Plant Chat: Bob Harper, The Biggest Loser," featuring a man with tattoos on his arms, wearing a black t-shirt, and a list of recent posts on the right side of the screen. The video returns to the first man, who continues to speak and gesture, maintaining the same plain white background. The video concludes with the man still speaking, emphasizing his points with hand gestures.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker, who initially uses a sarcastic tone to describe someone getting mugged repeatedly, followed by an example of a celebrity personal trainer being criticized by vegans. The speaker then transitions to a mocking tone, questioning the nature of vegans. There is no music or ambient sounds present.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. He appears to be explaining or discussing a topic, using various hand movements to emphasize his points. The scene transitions to another man in a black and white checkered shirt, sitting in front of a blue background with a microphone, suggesting he is giving a speech or presentation. The video then returns to the first man, who continues to speak and gesture, maintaining the same plain white background. The video concludes with the man in the black t-shirt still speaking and gesturing, with no significant changes in the environment or his actions.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip opens with one male speaker in a critical tone, warning against eating tofu. He then mentions a person named Stevo who was vegan for a decade but started eating fish in 2019, and points out the vegan community dislikes this. He quotes Stevo as saying "vegans can be annoying" and their views can pit people against you, before posing the question of whether anyone is truly vegan. The speaker recalls a previous video about bug butter and mentions the amount of insect parts in plant-based food, concluding by asking if consuming insects means you are not vegan.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. The scene then transitions to another man with long dreadlocks, wearing a black tank top, adorned with multiple necklaces and tattoos, standing against a dark background. The video then returns to the first man, who continues to speak and gesture against the white background. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man's upper body and hand movements, with no additional objects or text visible. The lighting is even, highlighting the subjects against their respective backgrounds.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker mentioning "vegan", followed by details about Waka Flocka Flame expressing frustration with vegans. The speaker mentions Waka Flocka Flame giving up a plant-based lifestyle and his perception that other vegans acted like "the cops". Waka Flocka Flame also disliked how "vegan" made him "sound like he felt superior to others".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of a news article featuring Beyoncé and Jay-Z, with the headline "Beyoncé and Jay-Z want their fans to go vegan." The article is dated January 2, 2016, and is authored by Samantha Marcotte. The image shows the two celebrities seated in a stadium, with Jay-Z pointing towards the camera and Beyoncé holding a popcorn bucket. The scene transitions to a man in a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. The video then cuts to a close-up of Chris Hemsworth, with the text "THE VEGAN DIET GIVES CHRIS HEMSWORTH HIS MARVEL-LOUS MUSCLES" displayed at the top. The man in the black t-shirt continues to speak, using various hand gestures to emphasize his points. The video maintains a consistent background throughout, focusing on the speaker and the text overlays.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker describing how Beyonce and Jay-Z explored veganism, "issued a 22-day vegan challenge" and encouraged people to buy their cookbook, but that they are "not vegan," and still eat meat. He then says Chris Hemsworth "wore the vegan title" without being vegan. In a more sarcastic and dramatic tone, the same male speaker imagines himself pretending to be vegan and then seen "eating a fat juicy steak," and then saying "oh well" to his audience, adding that "vegan diet is still great." A short, high-pitched squealing sound effect then plays abruptly.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of a news article featuring Ellen DeGeneres, who is holding a microphone and wearing a black sweater. The headline reads, "Ellen DeGeneres Confirms 'I Am Not Vegan Anymore'." The article explains that DeGeneres started eating fish a year or two ago after eight years of being vegan. The author of the article is Maria Chiorando, and the date is December 20, 2018. The scene then transitions to a man standing against a plain white background, wearing a black V-neck T-shirt. He is speaking and gesturing with his hands, occasionally clasping them together or spreading them apart. The man appears to be explaining something, as indicated by his expressive hand movements and facial expressions. The video maintains a simple and clean visual style, focusing on the man's upper body and his gestures.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker expressing skepticism, stating that "Ellen DeGeneres was allegedly on a strict plant-based diet for eight years, yeah, who believes that." He further mentions she now eats "fish and eggs" but "still promotes veganism." His tone is doubtful and somewhat critical. There are no identified music or background sounds present in the clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of a webpage featuring an article about Jennifer Lopez's decision to go vegan in May 2014. The article includes a photo of Lopez sitting in a car, wearing a brown leather jacket, with a caption explaining her choice to avoid dairy, meat, and other animal products, except for butter. The webpage also displays social media icons and links for following The Telegraph on various platforms. The scene then transitions to a man standing against a plain white background, wearing a black t-shirt and a necklace. He appears to be speaking, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is engaged in a conversation or delivering a message. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man, with no significant changes in the background or his attire throughout the sequence.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker, sharing how Jennifer Lopez turned to veganism after giving birth to her twins. He mentions how it supposedly helped her energy levels soar and after her 22 day vegan challenge, she reintroduced lean meats and fish. The speaker then states this as a practical application of what a vegan diet should be, as a fast for your body. He then adds if you don't want to water fast or just starve yourself, consuming vegetables and fruits is a way of starving yourself.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a split-screen image of two men dressed in formal attire, one in a white suit and the other in a dark suit with a bow tie, both wearing glasses. The scene then transitions to a man in a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, gesturing with his hands as he speaks. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, using expressive hand movements to emphasize his points. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man in the black t-shirt, with no additional objects or text visible, creating a simple and straightforward visual narrative.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing how "Samuel L. Jackson went vegan for seven months" after a health scare, resulting in so much weight loss he almost lost a film role. He states that Samuel L. Jackson ended his veganism "after going to a Shake Shack, not looking back since". The male speaker's tone is informative and slightly humorous.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman dressed in a black suit, standing against a dark background with the word "HERS" visible behind her. She has long, dark hair and is wearing dangling earrings. The scene then transitions to a man wearing a black t-shirt, standing against a plain white background. He is gesturing with his hands as he speaks, indicating that he is likely explaining or discussing something. The man's expressions and hand movements suggest he is engaged in a conversation or presentation. The video maintains a focus on the man as he continues to speak, with no significant changes in the background or his attire.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a female speaker discussing that actress Lea Michele "keeps a vegan home". She goes on to say the actress stocks the home with fruits and vegetables. The female speaker quotes that Lea explains she was vegan for a while but has since incorporated meat and other animal products back into her life. A different speaker, a male, discusses why people reach for snacks and eat all day. He attributes it to starving for micronutrient nutrition, predominantly due to a lack of bioavailable fat-soluble vitamins from animal foods in the diet.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a screenshot of a news article featuring a man in a dark suit and black shirt, standing against a black background with yellow text. The headline reads "Derek Hough Teases Holiday Special With Sister Julianne & 'World of Dance' Season 4," dated September 15, 2019, at 2:00 pm, by Michael Mosley. The article mentions Derek Hough's previous Emmy wins and his involvement in the new season of "World of Dance." The right side of the screen displays a sidebar with various news categories and headlines, including "The Dance Moms" and "World of Dance Recent Headlines." The scene then transitions to a man in a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, speaking directly to the camera. He gestures with his hands, occasionally pointing and moving them expressively, while maintaining eye contact with the viewer. The video maintains a consistent focus on the man's upper body and facial expressions, emphasizing his speech and gestures. The background remains plain and unobtrusive, ensuring the viewer's attention is directed towards the speaker. The video concludes with the man continuing to speak, his gestures becoming more animated, and his facial expressions conveying enthusiasm and engagement.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing professional dancer Derek Hough and his short-lived vegan diet, noting he only lasted about six weeks before succumbing to meat cravings, emphasizing that tolerance for vegan diets varies, some needing "to choke down some steak in two months," while others last longer. The speaker maintains a conversational tone throughout the discussion.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up shot of a woman with long, wavy brown hair and bangs, set against a blue background. She is wearing a black top and has a neutral expression. The scene transitions to another close-up of the same woman, now with a slight smile and wearing small hoop earrings, against a light blue background with a blue logo partially visible. The video then shifts to a man with dark hair tied back, wearing a black t-shirt, standing against a plain white background. He is speaking and gesturing with his hands, indicating he is explaining or discussing something. The man continues to speak and gesture throughout the video, with his expressions and hand movements changing slightly as he communicates. The background remains plain and white, keeping the focus on the man and his actions.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing Zoey Deschanel's dietary choices, noting her challenges with veganism and food sensitivities, and then shifts into a broader point about how media shapes public opinion. The speaker's tone is conversational and reflective. There's no noticeable background music or ambient sounds.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a black t-shirt standing against a plain white background, speaking and gesturing with his hands. The scene transitions to a woman with blonde hair, wearing a black strapless dress and a sparkling necklace, posing against a backdrop with the text 'EMMYS' and 'Television Academy' in yellow. The video then returns to the man in the black t-shirt, who continues to speak and gesture. The scene shifts to a woman with long blonde hair, wearing a green top, sitting in a cozy room with a brown couch and a globe in the background. The video then shows a woman with curly hair, wearing a gray blazer, posing against a plain background. The video returns to the man in the black t-shirt, who continues to speak and gesture. The video concludes with a woman with long blonde hair, wearing a black strapless dress and a sparkling necklace, posing against a backdrop with the text 'EMMYS' and 'Television Academy' in yellow.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing veganism, referencing celebrities like Laverne Cox who found it difficult to maintain a vegan diet, and others like Carrie Underwood who are more "practical" in their approach, as well as others who ended up eating meat or fish again. The speaker adopts a slightly critical tone, questioning the consistency of some celebrities' vegan claims. This is briefly followed by an audio stinger.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black t-shirt and a necklace, standing against a plain white background. He is seen making various hand gestures and movements, including pointing, raising his hands, and clasping his hands together. The man appears to be speaking or presenting something, as indicated by his facial expressions and body language. The video transitions to a webpage displaying various products, including meat and personal care items, with text such as "FREE RANGE MEAT" and "Frankie's Naturals." The webpage showcases items like "Grass Fed Wagyu Package," "Grass Fed Wagyu Ribeye Steak," and "Frankie's Ball Grease." The video then returns to the man, who continues to gesture and speak, before transitioning to another webpage featuring marble products with the text "CHISELED from MARBLE." The video concludes with the man making a final gesture, possibly emphasizing a point or wrapping up his presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker thanking listeners for joining, requesting that they "share the video", like and subscribe if they enjoyed it. He promotes Frankie's Free Range Meat, mentioning "a sale on brains for all of you zombies". He then advertises Frankie's Naturals for hygiene and cosmetic products and invites listeners to contact him for health consultations, remarking on the "overwhelming amount of former vegans reaching out". He ends by thanking the audience again and wishing them a good day. This is followed by slow, melancholic organ music.
